technique_name: Yáng Shèn Píng Héng (Backward Leaning Balance)
deduction_content: The raised leg is held below horizontal level

questions.question: What is the error code for Yáng Shèn Píng Héng (Backward Leaning Balance)?
What is the main deduction point for Yáng Shèn Píng Héng?
questions.answer: A deduction is applied when the raised leg is held below horizontal level.

questions.question: What is the correct position for the raised leg in Yáng Shèn Píng Héng?
questions.answer: The raised leg should be held at or above horizontal level.

questions.question: Why is this technique called 'Backward Leaning Balance'?
questions.answer: Because the body leans backward while maintaining balance with one leg raised forward.
